author: Asa Fitch
title: How Yemen’s Houthis Are Ramping Up Their Weapons Capability
text:
Dubai-- In three years of war between Yemen’s Houthi rebels and a Saudi-led military coalition, the rebels have fired scores of ballistic missiles at the kingdom. The rebels say they have attacked Saudi Arabia’s national oil company at least eight times since the beginning of March, with the latest missile fired on Monday.
Saudi forces have intercepted more than a 100, but a few incidents have caused damage—including in March, when a piece of shrapnel killed an Egyptian man living in Riyadh, the Saudi capital.
